timeline.bodyText: use dot "." for domain and dash ("-") for the names. e.g., "prometheus.query-chunk-size-duration"

enable TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE from Prometheus connector

timeline.bodyText: why not use TIMESTAMP_WITH_TIME_ZONE directly, instead of defining another constant?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: shall we have type checks? instead of using explicit type casting? same for following lines, e.g. (List)
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: sure, add a type handling
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: let's add cases for error and warning
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: log for warning, for error, it will throw a prestoException at the end of the logic by fall-thru
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: we only support default schema?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: yes, only support query against prometheus.default.tablename
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: do we need varcharMapType as a private data member? Or we could inline the value
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: varcharMapType cannot be inline because it's derived from typeManager when create a new PrometheusClient. We need to keep a local copy of TypeManager then derive which is unncessary
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText:
use one line comment:
// settable clock for testing
timeline.author: zhenxiao

+import java.time.LocalDateTime;
+import java.time.ZoneId;
+
+import static java.time.ZoneOffset.UTC;
+
+/**
+ * allow for settable Clock for testing

timeline.bodyText: same as comment in documentation: Prometheus coordinator host address
timeline.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: same as comment in documentation, let's rephrase the words
timeline.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: first line this.prometheusClient = requireNonNull(prometheusClient, "client is null")
timeline.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: static import FIELD_NAME
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: why calling 2 consecutive nextToken()? add comments?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: parsing json is key-value based, so first nextToken is advanced to the key, nextToken advances to the value. Added comment for clarification
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: remove this blank line
timeline.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: shall we define an error code, and add some information to the exception?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: sure, I added 2 catches, one from parsing ofPrometheusQueryResponse, one for mapping the result
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: have requireNonNull in the return value is not good. Let's add checks or throw exception in getFieldValue
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: let's throw exception or add checks, instead of return null here

timeline.message: enable TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE from Prometheus connector
enable TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE from Prometheus connector

timeline.bodyText: Here we actually implicitly enforce schema must be "default". How about we add a checkArgument in Metadata::listTables to check this condition there?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: PrometheusMetadata::listTables returns tables from default schema only if schema name is provided. it's not a hard enforcer so no explicitcheckArgument is needed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: create a member variable for this list?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: no necessary, it can be done as inlined
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: checkArgument(name is in (labels, timestamp, value))
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: yes good catch, include a sanity check here
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: why noStrictConfig?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: no need, removed, bootstrap.strict-config by default is on
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Where will this method be used?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: this method is used as the setter of the "value" property in PrometheusMetricResult entity
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Why we need this? Exactly same code exists in ServerMain module
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: redundant, removed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: this refactor is going to be included in the next commit, separate PR
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: QQ: Will result always return in single http call?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: The result after serde of query response is positioned by record cursor, so can be fetched in rows from cursor's block as a RecordPageSource
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Is the url related to prometheus cluster? if so, we should return empty list in getPreferredNodes interface.
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: no need, host address can be derived from uri which can be set for Prometheus coordinator's host address via prometheus.uri config
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Use https://guava.dev/releases/19.0/api/docs/com/google/common/base/Preconditions.html#checkState(boolean)
timeline.author: qqibrow

timeline.bodyText: Shall we add precheck for tableHandle.getPredicate()? What if it's a fixed set like (1,2,3) ?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: good point, the predicate validation is done inside PrometheusSplitManager::determinePredicateTimes on filter to apply of PrometheusColumnHandle.class
replies.author: fgwang7w
